param

Class ParamModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • explicit.ModelExplicit
      • param.ParamModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MDPGeneric<Function>, Model, NondetModel

    public final class ParamModel
extends ModelExplicit
implements MDPGeneric<Function>
    Represents a parametric Markov model. This class is used to store all types of parametric model, both models with and without nondeterminism, discrete- as well as continuous-time. This turned out the be the most convenient way to implement model checking for parametric models.

      • findDeadlocks

        public void findDeadlocks(boolean fix)
                   throws PrismException
        Description copied from interface: Model
        Find all deadlock states and store this information in the model. If requested (if fix=true) and if needed (i.e. for DTMCs/CTMCs), fix deadlocks by adding self-loops in these states. The set of deadlocks (before any possible fixing) can be obtained from Model.getDeadlockStates().
        Specified by:
        findDeadlocks in interface Model
        Throws:
        PrismException - if the model is unable to fix deadlocks because it is non-mutable.

      • reserveMem

        void reserveMem(int numStates,
                int numTotalChoices,
                int numTotalSuccessors)
        Allocates memory for subsequent construction of model.
        Parameters:
        numStates - number of states of the model
        numTotalChoices - total number of nondeterministic choices of the model
        numTotalSuccessors - total number of probabilistic transitions of the model

      • finishState

        void finishState()
        Finish the current state. Starting with the 0th state, this function shall be called once all nondeterministic decisions of the current nth state have been added. Subsequent method calls of finishChoice and addTransition will then apply to the (n+1)th state. Notice that this method must be called for each state of the method, even the last one, once all its transitions have been added.

      • finishChoice

        void finishChoice()
        Finished the current nondeterministic choice. Subsequent calls of addTransition will in turn add probabilistic branches to the next nondeterministic choice. Notice that this method has to be called for all nondeterministic choices of a state, even the last one. Notice that DTMCs and CTMCs should only have a single nondeterministic choice per state.

      • addTransition

        void addTransition(int toState,
                   Function probFn,
                   java.lang.String action)
        Adds a probabilistic branch to the current nondeterministic choice. Notice that by this function the probability to leave to a given state shall be specified, not the rate to this state. Instead, the sum of rates leaving a certain nondeterministic decision shall be specified using setSumLeaving.
        Parameters:
        toState - to which state the probabilistic choice leads
        probFn - with which probability it leads to this state
        action - action with which the choice is labelled

      • setSumLeaving

        void setSumLeaving(Function leaving)
        Sets the total sum of leaving rate of the current nondeterministic choice. For discrete-time models, this function shall always be called with leaving = 1.
        Parameters:
        leaving - total sum of leaving rate of the current nondeterministic choice

        Returns the number of the first nondeterministic choice of state.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Returns:

      • instantiate

        ParamModel instantiate(Point point,
                       boolean checkWellDefinedness)
        Instantiates the parametric model at a given point. All transition probabilities, etc. will be evaluated and set as probabilities of the concrete model at the given point.
        If checkWellDefinedness is true, checks that the instantiated probabilities are actually probabilities and graph-preserving. If that is not the case, this method then returns null.
        Parameters:
        point - point to instantiate model at
        checkWellDefinedness - should we check that the model is well-defined?
        Returns:
        nonparametric model instantiated at point

      • buildFromPrismExplicit

        public void buildFromPrismExplicit(java.lang.String filename)
                            throws PrismException
        Description copied from class: ModelExplicit
        Build (anew) from a list of transitions exported explicitly by PRISM (i.e. a .tra file). Note that initial states are not configured (since this info is not in the file), so this needs to be done separately (using ModelExplicit.addInitialState(int).
        Specified by:
        buildFromPrismExplicit in class ModelExplicit
        Throws:
        PrismException
